title: Malzahar is dead: 2018
body:
Sorry to clarify the obvious, but Malzahar was no carry. He was strong to a limited degree, but that was it.

Before, he could push well, and if the player was good clutch time, he could change the tide in a team fight, but now he's just ... bland. He could never be a Kat, or a Brand, or Kassadin, but he was what he was: Reasonable.

I have all his skins and enjoyed playing him before he was turned to ethereal toilet paper.

Keep up the good work, Rito.

replies.body: I'm sure his being dead is why he currently has a ~52% win rate and a nearly ~12% pick rate.

Good riddance.

Now they might finally realize that, like almost every champion that got a class update, he needed a full blown VGU with substantial changes to become a healthy addition to the game.
I miss AD Malz.... like a lot...

I can't wait for Malzahar to be gutted, and I hope he stays that way until he gets completely overhauled in however many years it takes for that to roll around.

If the ONLY way a champion can be viable is by having an obnoxious laning phase with zero interactivity in his kit then that champion is poorly designed and needs to be bad.

He is literally completely broken right now.
